snippet: Turkey’s prime minister said a Syrian plane forced to land in Ankara contained equipment and ammunition.
abstract: Turkey’s confrontation with Syria spreads to include Russia, Syria’s principal military ally, when Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan says Russian munitions intended for Syria’s government had been impounded from Syrian commercial jetliner forced to land in Turkey.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from Moscow, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Sebnem Arsu from Hatay, Turkey; Alan Cowell from Paris; and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: Turkey’s prime minister said a Syrian plane forced to land in Ankara contained equipment and ammunition.

headline.seo: Turkey Says Syrian Jet Carried Russian Arms
headline.main: Turkish Premier Says Russian Munitions Were Found on Syrian Jet
headline.print_headline: Turkish Premier Says Russian Munitions Were Found on Syrian Jet
